rename.from: Private+Anonymous Read repo: `/api/` archive return "The target couldn't be found."
rename.to: Private+Anonymous Read repo: `/api/../archive/` fails with "The target couldn't be found."

issue.title: Add anonymous access support for private/unlisted repositories

labels.name: type/feature
labels.description: Completely new functionality. Can only be merged if feature freeze is not active.

repository.name: gitea
repository.description: Git with a cup of tea! Painless self-hosted all-in-one software development service, including Git hosting, code review, team collaboration, package registry and CI/CD

issue.body:
Follow #33127

Fix #8649, fix #639

This is a complete solution. A repo unit could be set to:

* Anonymous read (non-signed-in user)
* Everyone read (signed-in user)
* Everyone write (wiki-only)

Diff with ignoring spaces: https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/pull/34051/files?diff=unified&w=1

body:
2 problems here:

1. API doesn't support HEAD request
2. API doesn't support anonymous user to read a private repo with public access
